member.name: M:_1_API.Controllers.UserAuthenticationController.UserLogin(_1_API.Request.UserAuthenticationRequest)
member.summary: Allows the user to log into the system providing a JWT token as authentication.
member.param: Body request parameters that represents the input credentials of the user.
member.returns: Returns a AuthenticationResults object as a valid response to the user's request.
member.remarks:
This endpoint allows the user to log into the system providing a JWT token and a refresh token as a valid authentication.
You have to provide the user's credentials such as password and username.
Here is an overview of the parameters of UserAuthenticationRequest:
• Username: The username of the user.
• Password: The password.
Both user's credentials are needed to log the user in successfully.
What's actually returns is a bit more complex, but still manageable.
The type of the returned response (successful log in) is an instance of AuthenticationResults.
AuthenticationResults has the following properties:
• token: The token used for any request.
• refreshToken: Allows the user to refresh their token.
• result: Successful or unsucessful.
• message: Just a message, nothing else.
member.response: Returns a valid session for the user login.

member.name: M:_1_API.Controllers.UserAuthenticationController.ObtainRefreshToken(_1_API.Request.RefreshTokenRequest)
member.summary: Refreshes the user's token for more request without re-logging in.
member.param: Body request parameters that represents the refresh token and the expired token.
member.returns: Returns a authorizationResponse object as a valid response to the user's new token request.
member.remarks:
This endpoint allows the user to refresh their token for more requests without re-logging in.
The parameters of the request are the following:
• ExpiredToken: The expired token.
• RefreshToken: The returned refresh token given when first login.
The type of the returned response is an instance of AuthenticationResults.
AuthenticationResults has the following properties:
• token: The token used for any request.
• refreshToken: Allows the user to refresh their token.
• result: Successful or unsucessful.
• message: Just a message, nothing else.
You can use refreshToken to request a new token using the expired token.
member.response: Returns another valid session for the user.

member.name: M:_1_API.Controllers.SearchController.SearchMain(_1_API.Request.SearchRequest)
member.summary: Search for publications based on the search criteria.
member.returns: A list of publications that match the search criteria.
member.remarks:
The search criteria is provided in the query parameter which is an object of type SearchRequest.
SearchRequest has the following properties:
• SearchInput: The search input; a string.
• Type: The type of search.
• PriceMin: The minimum price for the search.
• PriceMax: The maximum price for the search.
Each of these parameters represents the filters to find the perfect and suitable publication for the user.
Although, the algorithm used for searching is still primitive, it will suffice for simple demands by now.
Type is an integer representing an enumerator, it can be one of the following types representations:
• RealState: Type of search for real state publications is 0.
• Location: Type of search for locations is 1.
About price inputs, note that if PriceMin is greater than PriceMax, the controller will take the greatest value and
assign it to PriceMax as well as for the lower price to PriceMin.
member.response: Returns a list of publications corresponding to the query parameters.
